intro: Scorpiurus vermiculatus, commonly known as the common bladderworts, is a genus of aquatic and semi-aquatic flowering plants. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves and specialized structures called bladder-like organs that trap small aquatic animals. These plants are typically found in freshwater habitats such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Scorpiurus vermiculatus belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes other carnivorous plants. Its botanical features include showy, often yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators.
